description: This week on the GeekWire Podcast, our guest is entrepreneur and investor Ben Gilbert, co-founder and co-host of the hit podcast Acquired. Ben and his colleague David Rosenthal have developed a huge following for their deep-dive, long-form podcasts telling the stories behind some of the most successful companies in the world. They recently released Microsoft Volume II, the second installment in their epic exploration of the Redmond-based tech giant.  These are the years 1995 to 2014, from Bill Gates to Steve Ballmer, from Windows XP to Windows Vista and beyond — including Microsoft’s move into enterprise computing and video-game consoles,… Read More
title: Microsoft’s misunderstood era: Ben Gilbert of ‘Acquired’ on the tech giant’s most pivotal years

description: Tariq Yusuf‘s wake-up call came from Google. He was working as a security software engineer for the tech giant when the company came under scrutiny for the use of its image recognition technology to improve the targeting of drone strikes. Building products that could be used by the military or in any military application ran counter to Yusuf’s original entry into tech, when he viewed the industry as a force for good, designed to connect people and make a positive impact on the world. At the same time, he was making a shift into privacy engineering, ultimately working in roles at… Read More
title: Privacy engineer’s vision to use tech for good fuels his bid for Seattle City Council
